name: The Tenderloin Neighborhood Development Corporation
description: Low income housing with 88 studios (9 of the studios house people living with AIDS) for individuals and 74 apartments (comprised of one, two, and three bedroom units) for working families. The housing sits above 22,000 square feet of privately-financed commercial space that includes a childcare center, grocery store, and other neighborhood-serving organizations.
